title: Google\Cloud\NetworkSecurity\V1beta1\ServerTlsPolicy
name: ServerTlsPolicy
description:
ServerTlsPolicy is a resource that specifies how a server should authenticate incoming requests. This resource itself does not affect configuration unless it is attached to a target https proxy or endpoint config selector resource.

Generated from protobuf message google.cloud.networksecurity.v1beta1.ServerTlsPolicy

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.name
params.description: Required. Name of the ServerTlsPolicy resource. It matches the pattern projects/*/locations/{location}/serverTlsPolicies/{server_tls_policy}

params.name: data.create_time
params.description: Output only. The timestamp when the resource was created.

params.name: data.update_time
params.description: Output only. The timestamp when the resource was updated.

params.name: data.labels
params.description: Optional. Set of label tags associated with the resource.

params.name: data.allow_open
params.description: Optional. Determines if server allows plaintext connections. If set to true, server allows plain text connections. By default, it is set to false. This setting is not exclusive of other encryption modes. For example, if allow_open and mtls_policy are set, server allows both plain text and mTLS connections. See documentation of other encryption modes to confirm compatibility.

params.name: data.server_certificate
params.description: Optional. Defines a mechanism to provision server identity (public and private keys). Cannot be combined with allow_open as a permissive mode that allows both plain text and TLS is not supported.

params.name: data.mtls_policy
params.description: Optional. Defines a mechanism to provision peer validation certificates for peer to peer authentication (Mutual TLS - mTLS). If not specified, client certificate will not be requested. The connection is treated as TLS and not mTLS. If allow_open and mtls_policy are set, server allows both plain text and mTLS connections.

methods.name: getAllowOpen
methods.description:
Optional. Determines if server allows plaintext connections. If set to true, server allows plain text connections. By default, it is set to false. This setting is not exclusive of other encryption modes. For example, if allow_open and mtls_policy are set, server allows both plain text and mTLS connections.

See documentation of other encryption modes to confirm compatibility.

Generated from protobuf field bool allow_open = 6 [(.google.api.field_behavior) = OPTIONAL];
